On March 13 wide spread showers accompanied with thunderstorm and lighting is expected across Jharkhand. Parts of southern and central Jharkhand will witness light showers from March 14 to March 17. No heavy showers are predicted during this time across the State.

According to the weathermen, because of the cloud cover present, the maximum temperature which had reached around 30 degree Celsius has dropped by a couple of degrees. The minimum temperature has also increased and is being recorded at around 16 to 17 degree Celsius.

“When it is cloudy, the maximum temperature generally drops by a few degrees and the minimum temperature rises. Hence, during the day people generally tend to feel more cold as compared to at night,” added the official.

According to the weather bulletin issued on March 11, for the next few days the minimum temperature in Ranchi and its surrounding areas will be around 16 -17 degree Celsius while the maximum temperature will be at 25 or 26 degree Celsius.

Title: ‘Phag Mela 2020’ evokes good response
Article:
These days, the shoppers in the State Capital are enjoying an exquisite range of dress materials and other stuff at ‘Phag Mela 2020’ at Bhopal Haat. The fair that began from Tuesday is evoking a good response by the visitors.

On Wednesday, the shopaholics were seen buying the trendy, traditional and ethnic stuff at the exhibition.

The exquisite range of shopping material to the buyers. This time the Fag Mela is capturing the interest of the people which is really appreciable.

This is the annual mela organised by State Panchayat and Rural Development Department. Around 32 Self Help Groups (SHGs) from across the country have participated in the fair. These self employed vendors belong to the SHGs and live under the poverty line and so they earn the sale profit directly.

Artists from different states that include Chhattisgarh, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh have participated in the fair. Each stall has a magnificent array of the special item of their region.

The fair showcases a collection of bed sheets, cushion covers and other interior decorative stuff for one’s house. A variety of dress materials, imitation jewellery, foot-wears, ladies hand-bags and wallets are the centre of attraction for the female buyers at the fair.

Further, major collection from Madhya Pradesh such as a variety of Chanderi dress material, sarees, Dabu print, terracotta, Bagh print and jute and leather items could also be noticed there. The fair will conclude on March 15.

Title: 1 yr on, police yet to trace Aggarwal brothers’ killers
Article:
After one year of killing of two brothers’- Hemant Aggarwal and Mahendra Aggarwal, which took place at Ashok Nagar under Argora Police Station in the State Capital on March 6 in 2019, the main accused of the murder- Lokesh Chaudhary and his associate MK Singh are still away from the clutches of the Police.

Hatia Dy SP Vinit Kumar said that the Police are conducting raids from time to time to nab Chaudhary and his associates in the double murder case. “We are working to nab them with a focused plan. A Special Investigation Team (SIT) is constituted to find out whereabouts of the accused. The four member team is researching on various points to easily arrest Chaudhary,” he added.

The Dy SP said that the Police had cracked cases that took place in the past like killing of a mother with her daughter and locked under a room near Argora Police Station and arrested the accused. Similarly the Police are working to arrest Chaudhary. “It is only one old case remained, which the Police have to crack it is sure that will be solve at its earliest,” he added.

It may be mentioned here that two brothers have been shot dead at a news channel office in the State Capital on March 6, 2019. The News Channel Head, Lokesh Chaudhary and his associate, MK Singh is the main accused in the case.

According to sources Chaudhary owed Rs five lakh to Mahendra Aggarwal and his younger brother Hemant Agarwal. To recover this money, both brothers went the office of the news channel situated at Ashok Nagar on the day of killing. Since then, they did not return. When both the brothers did not return till late night, the family members registered a case at Lalpur Police Station about their missing. The Police started investigation after they found contact numbers of both the brothers.

On the location of Hemant’s phone police found their body lying in the Channel Office.

The Police team informed SSP Anish Gupta, then City SP Sujata Veenapani. As soon as the information was received, they reached at the spot with force of many police stations. Police found that both the brothers were shot with rifle. On the basis of her investigation then SP City registered a case against Chaudhary, his personal bodyguard and two more people.

Chaudhary is a resident of Benipur in Darbhanga district of Bihar.

SSP Ranchi Gupta, had constituted a SIT to solve the mystery of this killing. Also, for the arrest of Chaudhary, police alerted in the districts adjacent to Patna and the airport, railway station, bus stands near Patna.

Title: ‘If you have diabetes, sleep apnea can make it more difficult to manage your diabetes’
Article:
“If you have diabetes, sleep apnea can make it more difficult to manage your diabetes,” said Dr Ashwini Malhotra of Bansal Hospital.

She was addressing a talk on World Sleep Day. She said that according to the National Institutes of Health (NIH), approximately 18 million people have sleep apnea, with up to 80 percent of people undiagnosed.

It is to be noted that World Sleep Day is an annual event organized by the World Sleep Day Committee of the World Sleep Society, formerly World Association of Sleep Medicine, since 2008. The goal is to celebrate the benefits of good and healthy sleep and to draw society's attention to the burden of sleep problems and their medical, educational, and social aspects, and to promote the prevention and management of sleep disorders.

She further said that inadequate rest or sleep can also lead to lack of motivation to exercise or plan meals. Sleepiness also can cause people to forget to take their medications and lead to further diabetes complications.

Sleep apnea may be genetically linked and it is most commonly found in those who are overweight or obese, people who smoke and are over the age of 40.

To diagnose sleep apnea, you can undergo a sleep test called a polysomnogram, which is a test that records body functions while you sleep. The test measures eye movements, electrical brain activity, muscle activity, heart rate, breathing and blood oxygen levels. She also talked about different treatments for snoring.

Title: City students hail RU’s Radio Khanchi 90.4 FM
Article:
Radio Khanchi 90.4 FM – Hum sab ka radio’ the community based radio show of Ranchi University (RU) was launched on March 8. Aimed to give the students a platform to showcase their talent as future radio jockeys, it will also provide them with information related to the various colleges under RU.

The first show was inaugurated by the Governor cum RU Chancellor Draupadi Murmu on International Women’s Day. The community radio programme can be heard across a distance of about 15 Kms in the State capital. The student fraternity of Ranchi seems to be very excited with this new initiative taken by the university.

“The community radio show is a very unique concept of RU. Apart from sharing information relevant to the colleges, it will also give them a platform to showcase their hidden talent like poetry, mimicry, singing and drama. Information related to important dates like registration, exam schedule, cultural fests will also be shared on a regular basis so that nobody misses out an opportunity,” said Vaibhavi Singh, a first year Mass Communication student, RU.

Another student Kumar Sambhav, pursuing his post graduation in Mass Communication feels that the radio show will open a lot of avenues for the students of RU. “This is a great opportunity espically for the students of the mass communication department to get a hands on experience right here in the college premises. It will provide us with practical knowledge for which we would otherwise have to go out. Apart from showcasing our talent, we will also learn on how a radio actually functions.”

An array of prgrammes has been lined up for the entertainment and benefit of the students. ‘Khanhci Quiz Time’ a quiz competition for students from various colleges and departments will go on air soon. Students will also be able to show their talents in mimicry, singing, standup comedy and poetry in a new talent show.

“Because a lot of students have gone home for Holi celebrations, the registration of the show is not much right now.

But in the coming days, the listernship will definitely increase. Those who have heard the programme have given a very positive response. The radio show is for the welfare of the students and the society at large. Programmes are being done by the students and teachers of RU and it will be an infotainment channel.

Presently a message on Coronavirus is also being played to spread awareness. Students will also present songs in regional languages in the coming days,” said Director Radio Khanchi Anand Kumar Thakur.

Title: Colourful celebration marks Holi
Article:
Steel City erupted in colours as thousands poured out of houses and building complexes from early Tuesday to play Holi. Excited youngsters grabbed an early start in the celebrations, followed by youths and the elders who joined in later.

Amidst stray cases of violence in the city the festival of colours Holi was celebrated peacefully. It was a riot of colours on Jamshedpur streets as the old and young joined hands to celebrate Holi, which marks the beginning of spring.

Revellers splashed colours on each other as they exchanged embraces across the lanes and by-lanes in the city to celebrate the festival of colours. Children had most of the fun as they sprayed coloured water using water guns and hurled water-filled balloons on people from the safety of their rooftops.

The young and the old splashed colours on each other with religious songs in the background adding to the perfect ambience in several areas. Effigies of Holika, the sister of Hiranyakashyap, the demon king, were set ablaze at several places symbolising the destruction of evil.

Nevertheless, the security alertness on the day that is on the day of Holi, was moderate with no special arrangement for traffic movement and people had easy access to their destinations. However, patrolling of the police vans at higher pace was the only highlight of the administration as far as security measures for the Holi was concerned.

“Past record suggest that Holi has never been a festival inviting trouble to the district administration so far, and therefore security has never been a big concern for the police barring of course, the petty incidents of brawl involving people in drunken state of mind,”said, a district official.

The police had issued warning against hooliganism in the guise of revelry. Commuters faced inconveniences in the morning as the public transport, such as buses and metro were shut till late afternoon. Notwithstanding, the security arrangements the police have registered few incidents of clash between the excited Holi enjoyers in Telco, Sonari and Chota Govindpur police stations.

Forgetting all rancour and old grievances, people from all walks of life exchanged embraces wishing "Happy Holi" as unseen hands squirted them with a well-timed coloured water spray.

Title: Panki MLA finds shelter scheme’s skeletons
Article:
BJP MLA from Panki Shashibhushan Mehta has threatened to raise the shelter racket of Panki block on the floor of the House. He has discovered 17 houses meant for primitive tribe group Parhaiyya far from completion since 2017 -18 when Panki had a Congress MLA.

Mehta said, “These 17 highly poor and vulnerable group of Parhaiyyas have been cheated of their houses under Birsa Yojna. These houses are of the year 2017 -18. The fund for these houses has been siphoned off and this primitive tribe group is rotting in pains.”

Mehta further said, “As per the version of the victim parhaiyyas each house was worth 1.31 lakh. But only one foot to three feet wall has been raised and house has been shown to have been completed and money taken by the middlemen.”

The BJP MLA said, “The Assembly is in the session. I will raise this issue as a starred question. This is the height of the crime against the poor. Can only middlemen do this?”

Mehta said, “There is loot all around, be it house scheme or road or culver making etc in the year 2014 -19.”

This last Assembly election 2019 Mehta gave a crushing defeat to Congress’ Bittu Singh and now Mehta is all out to expose the corruption in public or beneficiary utility schemes like these 17 houses under Birsa Awas for PTG Parhaiyyas, which are not by any stretch worth calling any house as there is just a few feet walls only.

The MLA said, “A particular pragya Kendra operator in Panki, two or three middle men and unscrupulous officials of the Panki block have so duped the innocent Parhaiyyas.”

Mehta spoke to district welfare officer Nisha Tirkey from the site of these duped Parhaiayya families who live in their shattered earlier houses at Jaspur 58 kms away from Daltonganj asking the lady officer to visit Jaspur first to have a feel as to how these poor have been so left in lurch of a housing scheme of 2017 -18.

This correspondent also spoke to Nisha Tirkey in this regard to know as to how this case of fraud in housing scheme never came to light in all these years since 2017 -18 to which Nisha Tirkey said, “I will seek a report from the Panki BDO in this connection.”

Panki BDO S Murmu said, “I took over charge of Panki only this last October and hence have not much of this idea and information about this racket.”

Nand Kishore Parhaiyya, Nirmal Parhaiyya, Rajoya Devi, Matia Devi and many others there at Jaspur mobbed the MLA asking him to first punish the middle men whom they called Yadavs who has so cheated them by obtaining their thumb impressions and diverting fund for their houses into these middlemen’s accounts.

Title: Dishom Guru Shibu Soren files nomination for RS polls
Article:
Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) patriarch Shibu Soren on Wednesday filed nomination for the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections in Jharkhand in presence of his son, Chief Minister Hemant Soren, and other Ministers in the latter’s Cabinet. Seventy-six-year-old Soren, a three-time Chief Minister and an eight-time MP from Dumka Lok Sabha constituency, was a unanimous choice of JMM party workers for the RS candidature, party leaders said.

Popularly known as ‘Guruji’ in the political circuit here, Soren is looked up to by leaders across Jharkhand irrespective of ideologies and political affiliations. Soren was one of the pillars of the Jharkhand Movement, which led to the formation of a separate State. He is still seen as the most influential ‘people’s leader’ in the tribal-dominated Santhal Pargana region of Jharkhand by many political experts.

Soon after Soren filed his nomination to Vidhan Sabha Secretary Mahendra Prasad, Chief Minister Hemant Soren said that he was sure of the his father’s election in the upper house of the parliament. “Guruji will be elected to the upper house of the parliament. We are also eyeing the second Rajya Sabha seat in the State, and our candidate for it will be announced soon,” he said.

Finance Minister Rameshwar Oraon, who also happens to be the President of Jharkhand Pradesh Congress Committee (JPCC), said that both the Rajya Sabha seats in Jharkhand will go to the UPA fold this year. Later in the day, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) fielded its State President Deepak Prakash for the Rajya Sabha elections. JMM has 29 seats in the 81-member Assembly, while Congress party has 16 seats. The third partner, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has only one legislator in Jharkhand. BJP, the second largest party in the Assembly, has 26 legislators.

Elections will be held for two of six Rajya Sabha seats in Jharkhand, currently occupied by BJP’s Parimal Nathwani and RJD’s Premchand Gupta, this year. The Election Commission of India (ECI) has announced that the elections for the two seats in Jharkhand will be held on March 26. The notification for the elections was issued on March 6 and March 13 will be the last date for filing nominations.

The nominations will be scrutinized on March 16 and candidates can withdraw their nomination by March 18.

One of the veterans of Jharkhand Movement, senior Soren lost to Bharatiya Janata Party’s (BJP) Sunil Soren in Dumka – a JMM stronghold – during the Lok Sabha elections held last year. It was his second consecutive defeat in Lok Sabha elections. The 76-year-old is battling health concerns due to ageing and has been frail lately, sources from the party said.

Title: Dr Sahoo meets Governor
Article:
Dr Manoj Kumar Sahoo and his team who successfully conducted the State’s first liver transplantation recently met Governor Prof Ganeshi Lal at the Raj Bhavan here on Wednesday.

In a programme on Monday, Dr Sahoo, who is the Head of Department, Gastroenterology, Sum Hospital, felicitated Abinash Nayak as the latter won the Star Plus Amul present Master Chef Season-6 . It is a proud moment for all of us, Dr Sahoo told. Notably, Dr Sahoo was first to transplant liver in Odisha.

Title: No biometric attendance in Govt offices
Article:
The State Government on Wednesday issued a circular prohibiting the use of biometric attendance in all Government offices across Jharkhand amid Novel Coronavirus fear – a precautionary measure taken in a bid to prevent the virus from spreading in the State, officials from the Department of Personnel and Administrative Reforms said.

“We have issued a circular asking all Government offices across Jharkhand to stop the use of biometric attendance temporarily as a precautionary measure against Novel Coronavirus,” Personnel and Administrative Reforms Secretary AK Singh said. Almost all Government offices in Jharkhand, and also schools and colleges, use biometrics to mark the attendance of employees. Their attendance, sources said, will now be marked manually in registers.

Meanwhile, Rajendra Institute of Medical Science (RIMS) in Ranchi on Wednesday sent samples of three persons to labs for Coronavirus tests.

The premiere State-run hospital has already sent eight samples for tests in the past month or so, and none of them came out positive, said RIMS Superintendent Dr. Vivek Kashyap. “The three fresh samples sent today (Wednesday) are all of people staying in and around Ranchi. We will get the test results by Friday,” he said.

RIMS has also arranged for 450 pieces of N95 masks for protection of caregivers at the hospital, said Kashyap, adding that as per the current situation in the hospital, the number of masks available was sufficient. “We do not have any positive cases of Cornavirus yet. We are only keeping symptomatic patients and the ones who have travelled to affected countries under observation,” said Kashyap.

N95 masks are special protective masks used by medical practitioners and caregivers working in close proximity with patients.

However, it is not for use by commoners as they do not come in close contact with patients, said Kashyap, adding that three-layer surgical masks were as effective as N95 masks in case commoners wish to wear masks for their safety.

RIMS has also set up an 18-bed Isolation Ward for Coronavirus patients. All the nurses and doctors working in the ward have been provided N95 masks and elaborately explained about the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) in case a patient complains of symptoms similar to that of Coronavirus and is admitted in the hospital.

At least 80 residents of Jharkhand are under observation amid Coronavirus fear, but none of them have tested positive in the tests so far, officials from the Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme (IDSP) have said.

As many as 21 persons are under observation for Coronavirus in Jamshedpur – the highest among all the major cities in Jharkhand, IDSP officials said.

As many as eight people are under observation in Capital Ranchi and 16 in Saraikela, they added. Around eight people are under observation in Bokaro too.

“Only those residents of Jharkhand who have travelled to places like Italy, China, Hong Kong, Thailand, Malaysia and other affected countries have been kept under observation here,” said IDSP Director Rakesh Dayal.

Title: 42 weight cheating cases filed against traders
Article:
As many as 42 cases have been registered against businessmen for not renewing weights and measures and a total fine of Rs 29,800 collected from them during 17 raids conducted in big haats in Bhubaneswar between April 2019 and January-end 2020.

Food Supplies and Consumer Welfare Minister Ranendra Pratap Swain informed this in the State Assembly in response to a question of BJD MLA Anant Narayan Jena on Wednesday.

The Minister further informed that a revenue of Rs 30,79,827 was collected by way of annual inspection of weights and measures of 7,977 traders in Bhubaneswar. The State Government has a provision to collect fine from traders for deceiving people in weight and measure as per Section 30 of the Legal Metrology Act 2009.

Title: BJP to launch agitation over LoP issue
Article:
The State BJP has declared that if BJP legislative party leader Babulal Marandi is not accorded the status of Leader of Opposition by March 12, then the party will launch a phase-wise agitation in State. State BJP vice president Pradeep Verma said that the Election Commission of India (ECI) has approved the merger of JVM-P with BJP and order in this regard has been also issued by the commission in which it has agreed that JVM-P as party has become non-existent and its symbol has been also seized.

He said that now as per the norms Babulal Marandi should be made the Leader of Opposition without further delay so that the house can function without any hindrance. Verma indirectly attacking the Soren Government behind delay in granting LoP status to Marandi said, “The State Government is continuously exerting pressure on Speaker and he is prevented from fulfilling his duties which is an attack on the soul of the democracy.”

The BJP leader without naming any leader directly said that the ruling party should understand that the chair of the Speaker is impartial and Opposition had a great role to play in the development of the state therefore for the betterment of the State, the House should immediately declare Babulal Marandi as Leader of Opposition.

The BJP plans to carry out state wide agitation assume importance as last week (March 6), the Election Commission of India (ECI) approved the merger of Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (Prajatantrik) party, led by Babulal Marandi with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). The ECI in this connection has even issued letter which reads, “Taking into consideration all the documents on record including the report of CEO, Jharkhand, the Commission is satisfied that JVM(P) has merged with the BJP, a National Party. Accordingly, the Commission has decided under the provisions of Paragraph l6 of the Symbols Order, that on its merger with the BJP, the JVM(P) has ceased to exist as a separate political party and the name of the 'Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (Prajatantrik)' be removed from the list of political parties," the letter from the ECI read.

Notably, JVM merged with the BJP at an event in Ranchi on February 17 in the presence of Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah.

The BJP has been raising the demand to accord LoP status to Marandi in house since the Assembly proceedings began on February 28.

The Assembly has been witnessing noisy scenes over the delay in designating Babulal Marandi, who was elected the leader of the BJP legislature party recently, as the Leader of Opposition.

Title: DJ van owner fined Rs 52, 277
Article:
The Bhubaneswar RTO-II officials on Wednesday imposed a penalty of Rs 52,277 on the owner of a DJ van on charges of violating multiple rules under the amended Motor Vehicle Act.

The officials fined DJ van owner Laxmidhar Nayak, a resident of Balipatana in Khordha district for running the vehicle without fitness certificate, PUC certificate, permit, insurance documents and Motor Vehicle tax documents.

As per reports, Rs 5,000 fine was imposed for running the vehicle without registration document and fitness certificate, Rs 10,000 for violating air and noise pollution, Rs 10,000 for plying without permit, Rs 2,000 for not having insurance and Odisha Motor Vehicle Tax for the period from July 1, 2018 to March 31, 2020. Also the truck owner was fined Rs 500 for general offence.

Title: Govt rejects ‘hunger' death
Article:
The Bokaro district administration has denied that the man Bhukhal Ghasi of Kamra village in Bokaro district died due to starvation, but was suffering from disease. Following the allegation made social that Ghasi died due starvation, Chief Minister Hemant Soren had ordered a probe in the case.

Kasmar BDO Rajesh Kumar Sinha said, “We have carried out a probe in the death and came to know that the man was suffering from some disease and was undergoing treatment from local doctors.”

Sinha said, “Ghasi’s three brothers informed district administration officials that in July/August Ghasi returned from Bangalore. His body was swollen. He was undergoing treatment from a local doctor.”

The BDO claimed that the victim’s brother also informed that Gomia MLA Lambodar Mahto too had agreed to provide medical treatment to Ghasi at Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences (RIMS).

On the intervention of Gomia lawmaker ambulance was arranged at Ghasi’s house twice.

He was to be admitted at RIMS, but as there was no attendant for patient so he was not admitted.

Sinha also claimed that the district administration also went through the economic condition of victim’s.

The victim (Ghasi) and his three brothers jointly owned 1 acre 35 decimals land at Kamra village.

Ghasi is survived by five children who included three daughters and two sons. One daughter and son are married. The district administration also came to know that both his sons are earning while one son works at a local brick kiln the other one works at hotel in Petarwar.

The district administration also came to know that as Ghasi was living with his father the ration card was in the name of Bhukhal Ghasi’s father Ramu Ghasi, but after the death the ration card had expired and Bhukal’s family members had applied for it.

Ghasi, who was working as a labourer in Bangalore, returned home after his parents died within two days in July last year due to age-related ailments. The house allotted to his parents under Indira Awas Yojana is being used by Ghasi’s married son while he and his wife stayed in a mud house nearby, official sources said.

The district administration as financial assistance had provided Rs 20,000 to deceased family members and even ordered for pension to deceased’s widow.

This is the first instance of alleged starvation death since the JMM/Congress/RJD government came to power in December last year.

On November 7 last year, the then state food and civil supplies minister Saryu Roy had said there was a protocol to give ration under the Annapurna Yojana to the needy.

There are grain banks and Rs 10,000 has been given to village heads, who can be approached for assistance, he had said.

Title: Police constable allegedly commits suicide in Dumka
Article:
A 30-year-old police constable allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from a ceiling fan at his official barrack at police line in Dumka, said Superintendent of police YS Ramesh. The deceased identified as Arun Kumar was posted in the police line unit of the Dumka district, the police said on Wednesday.

The incident came to light on Wednesday afternoon when another constable reached barrack and saw him hanging from the fan, the SDPO of Dumka town Pujaya Prakash, said.

Arun Kumar hailing from Ghatshila area in Jamshedpur was alone in the police barrack when he took the extreme step, the police said, adding no suicide note was recovered from there. Police suspect that family problem could have driven him to take the extreme step,but the main cause behind the step has not yet been acertained and investigation is going on, police added. The body was handed over to his family members after post-mortem and the matter was under investigation, the S.P. said.

Title: Resort politics on to avert poaching of MP legislators
Article:
Amid a political crisis triggered by former Guna MP Jyotiraditya Scindia's exit from the party, the Congress on Wednesday afternoon flew its remaining 88 MLAs from Bhopal to Jaipur in order to prevent poaching by the BJP.

The MLAs, who were received by Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot at the airport, are likely to stay at the Buena Vista Resort in Jaipur. Two MLAs of the BSP, one from SP and independent accompanied the Congress legislators.

The BJP MLAs are staying put in ITC Grand Bharat in Manesar in Haryana.

Around 20 rebel Congress MLAs have been lodged in a resort in Bengaluru. They have claimed to have resigned from the legislative Assembly. The Congress has sent two of its leaders, Sajjan Singh Verma and Govind Singh, to Bengaluru in order to pacify some of the rebel MLAs and bring them back to the party.

The grand old party has been witnessing an internal turf war in Madhya Pradesh since the party formed the Government in the State in 2018. The crisis deepened on Tuesday after Scindia resigned from the party and at least 22 MLAs close to him announced to withdraw support from the Nath Government.

In 2018 Assembly results, the Congress, which won 114 seats in the 230-member Assembly formed the Government with the support of four Independent MLAs and two BSP MLAs and a legislator from the Samajwadi Party (SP). The BJP had secured 109 seats in the State Assembly.

While there are clear indication that the present Nath Government would not survive for want of the required number of MLAs, Congress leader Verma on Wednesday said they (leaders who are in Bengaluru) are neither willing to support Scindia nor in favour of joining the BJP as they were misled and taken to Bengaluru in Karnataka.

"Nobody is ready to go with Scindia. They said they were misled and taken to Bengaluru, most of them said they are not ready to join BJP," Verma claimed.

"I just came from Bengaluru and now I am going to Jaipur. Besides 5-6 Ministers and one MLA, we all are going to Jaipur. They (MLAs) have said they have the blood of Congress and they will remain in the party. Since Scindia was a senior party leader, all our MLAs followed his order as a courtesy," he said.

He also claimed that he is in contact with 7-8 BJP MLAs.

Senior party leader Digvijaya Singh claimed on Wednesday that thirteen of the 22 rebel Congress MLAs don't want to quit the party and were led away only to create pressure on the leadership to nominate Scindia to the Rajya Sabha. He also asserted that the Nath-led Government in the State, pushed to the brink of collapse with the resignation of 22 MLAs, will win a floor test.

Meanwhile, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Bala Bachchan said the Nath Government will prove the majority in Assembly and complete its five-year term. "The Congress is in a safe and strong position. Everybody is in touch with the Chief Minister, everything will be alright soon. We will prove majority on the floor of the Assembly and our Government will continue till 2023," said Bachchan while speaking to reporters here.

Besides, Congress MLA Umang Singhar said the resignations of MLAs who are in Bengaluru have not been accepted yet. "All MLAs are in touch with us; their resignations have not yet been accepted," he said.

However, Madhya Pradesh Women and Child Development Minister and rebel Congress MLA Imarti Devi on Wednesday reaffirmed her loyalty to Scindia and said she will always stand alongside him "even if I had to jump into a well". The Minister said she and 21 other rebel Congress MLAs are camping in Bengaluru out of their own volition and with the blessings of Scindia. Imarti welcomed the former Congress leader's decision to join the BJP.

After Scindia quit the Congress, around 10,000 of its office-bearers have resigned from the party in Madhya Pradesh and several more are likely to do so, a former leader of the grand old party claimed on Wednesday. The ruling Congress, however, refuted this claim and said the supporters of Scindia were creating pressure on other leaders to leave the party.

"About 10,000 office-bearers of the Congress in Madhya Pradesh- from state-level to block-level, including some district presidents, have resigned from the Congress since Tuesday morning owing their allegiance to Scindia ji," former state Congress spokesman Pankaj Chaturvedi, who also quit the party along with Scindia, told PTI on Wednesday.

The district presidents of Guna, Sagar, Ashok Nagar, Gwalior, Indore, Shivpuri and some other districts have resigned from the party, Chaturvedi, a staunch Scindia supporter, said.

Title: Dehariya scales Oz highest peak on Holi
Article:
After climbing the highest peak of the continent Africa 'Mount Kilimanjaro' on Diwali, Indian Mountaineer Bhawna Dehariya successfully climbed the another highest peak of Australia 'Mount Kosciuszko' on the day of festival Holi, on Monday.

Disseminating the beauty of Indian culture at the peak, Dehariya played colours and promoted Indian culture.

Talking about journey, Dehariya said, "I feel fortunate enough that I celebrated two biggest festivals of India at the mountain peaks. Earlier also I did my Africa summit of Mount Kilimanjaro on the occasion of Diwali on November 27, 2019 and this time also I did my summit of Australia on the occasion of Holi. Thus, these summits will be so memorable to me."

This summit was supported by the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Board (MPTB)", for which Dehariya has expressed her gratitude towards the board wholeheartedly.

Dehariya reached Australia on March 6 and completed the summit on March 10. She unfurled the national tricolor flag at the peak. “Happy Holi to all my near and dear once from the Highest Peak of Australia Continent Mount Kosciuszko,” she tweeted.

Besides, she promoted the Madhya Pradesh 'Tourism' and 'Adventure Sports' by displaying banner at the peak. She also met Indian Ambassador there and will return to Bhopal on March 12 on Wednesday.

Notably, Bhawna is one among the first women from Madhya Pradesh to climb the Mount Everest on May 22, 2019. She has also climbed Mount Aconcagua, South America reaching height of 6,500 meters on December 31, 2019; Mount Manirang, Himachal Pradesh, covering 6,593 metres summit in August 2018 and Mount DKD 2nd (5,670 metres) Ghadwal summit in 2017. Dehariya’s feat is being celebrated in Madhya Pradesh with people of her hometown praising her for her hard work and dedication.

Title: Tahir, PFI booked for money laundering, funding riots
Article:
The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has booked suspended Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) councillor Tahir Hussain, Popular Front of India (PFI) and some others on the charges of money laundering and alleged funding of last month's communal riots in North-east Delhi, officials said here on Wednesday.

They said the agency has filed a criminal case against Hussain, facing charges of killing an Intelligence Bureau official during the riots, under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

Similar charges have been pressed against the PFI, which is already facing a separate PMLA probe for allegedly fuelling protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) in various parts of the country. The ED is expected to seek Hussain's custody to question him in the PMLA case. Hussain is currently in the custody of Delhi Police in connection with the IB official's murder case.

The ED has taken cognisance of a clutch of FIRs filed by Delhi Police's Crime Branch to probe the alleged money laundering and routing of illegal funds by Hussain, PFI and others to purportedly sponsor the communal riots which claimed 44 lives and injured over 200 persons, officials said. Hussain, an AAP corporator for ward number 59 under the Mustafabad Assembly seat in Delhi, was booked by the police in the murder case of IB staffer Ankit Sharma during the communal riots in North-east Delhi late last month.

The family of Sharma (26), found dead in a drain near his home in riot-hit Chand Bagh area, has accused Hussain of being involved in his killing. The PFI was already being probed by the ED for allegedly routing about Rs 120 crore funds to fuel anti-CAA riots in the country and the agency has questioned about half-a-dozen of its office bearers over the last fortnight and the outfit's alleged role in funding the Delhi riots is under the scanner, they said.

The PFI and associated organisations are originally being probed by ED as part of a 2018 ECIR (enforcement case information report), FIR in police parlance. However, the PFI has in the past denied any wrongdoing.

Title: Suspended councillor’s three associates arrested
Article:
The Special Investigation Team (SIT) has arrested three associates of suspended Aam Aadmi councillor, Tahir Hussain in connection with the communal riots in North-east Delhi that took place on February 24.

The trio has been identified as Abid, a resident of Dayalpur, and Mohd Shahdab and Rashid Saifi, both from Nehru Vihar. According to senior police official, the trio was arrested by Crime Branch on Tuesday.

"The Abid, Shahdab and Rashid were seen by the eyewitnesses on the top floor of the building owned by Hussain on February 24, where police had earlier found petrol filled bottles, stones and some toxic substances. It is suspected that they were involved in pelting stones and throwing petrol filled bottles during the communal riots in North-east Delhi," said sources.

"The trio is also accused of being with Hussain on February 24. Their involvement in IB staffer Ankit Sharma will be ascertained after interrogation," the sources further said. The Crime Branch on Monday arrested Hussain's brother Shah Alam in connection with the riots. Three other people, who were sheltering Alam, were also arrested.

Hussain was arrested by Delhi Police last week after a court here dismissed his plea seeking to surrender before it in connection with the killing of Intelligence Bureau (IB) official Ankit Sharma during the violence over the new citizenship law.

Title: Don’t arrest innocents, don’t spare guilty: Rai
Article:
Delhi Cabinet Minister Gopal Rai on Wednesday met senior police officials and discussed law and order situation of North-east Delhi post- riots.

Rai, senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader also discussed issues raised by the local people regarding law and order and asserted strict action against those who have strong evidence against them.

Soon after the meeting with joint CP and DCP North-east, Rai said, "Police should take stern action against whom there is evidence, innocent people should not be harassed and arrested based on any provocation or misleading information."

Incidentally, On February 23, during communal violence 53 people lost lives while around 250 were injured. Delhi Government, after an assessment, released compensation amount to the riot victims.

Adding furthermore, Rai said that after the violent riots that took place in Delhi, we have been getting complaints from different constituencies that cases have been filed against people who were not involved in the riots.

Citing incidents reports, AAP leader said that we had held a meeting with the police officials earlier on the situation and found out that the lower level police officials are filing the cases. "We met the senior officials today and deliberated on how the police officials must be careful in reporting such cases so that innocent people are not arrested or wrongly framed," said the AAP leader, "Strict action must be taken against those who have strong evidence against them. No action on behalf of the police must be taken under any provocation or if it is misleading. The police have assured that no wrong action will be taken and the senior officers will also take cognizance of such a complaint."

This may noted further Rai who is also the Member of Legislative Assembly of Babarpur in North East Delhi has continuously monitored the situation in the aftermath of the riots.

Rai also visited the Mustafabad relief camps to meet the victims of the riot and met Delhi Police Commissioner and discussed the law and order situation of North East Delhi with him earlier also.

In February, violent riots ravaged the north-eastern part of Delhi, killing many people and bringing forth a loss of crores of rupees.

The people who were rendered homeless in the riots have been staying at the relief camps of the Delhi government, some of them have gone to their relatives or acquaintances.

Title: 3 Africans involved in narcotics trafficking held
Article:
The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has nabbed three African nationals allegedly involved in trafficking of narcotic substance and money laundering in country. The NCB official said that they have also recovered 255 gm cocaine, 350 gm heroin and 100 gm Methamphetamine from their possession.

The accused have been identified as Butter Nnamani (35), presently living at South Delhi's Malviya Nagar, Eze Naduka Bonaventure (36), living at Chattarpur area and Kelvin Mansary alias Ben (30), presently residing in Haryana's Gurugram area. NCB official said that all three are permanent residents of Nigeria.

According to KPS Malhotra, the Zonal director, NCB, after receiving specific that the members of an international syndicate which has been involved in drugs and other money laundering activities, a NCB team conducted raids and nabbed the trio.

"During interrogation, the accused revealed that Ben was a major point of sale of drugs. Ben used to collect the contrabands from Butter and Eze. The document verification of Ben revealed that he was having a fake passport, which when verified was found to be of some Belgian national. He could not produce any valid document of stay in India," said Malhotra.

"On further interrogation, the accused revealed some names associated with them. The most noteworthy were Kumar (name changed to keep the identity secret), Vishal and Robert Polanco. They were planning to get huge amounts of money transferred through money laundering channel. They were having access to some dormant accounts in which huge amounts were parked but those accounts were inactive. As per their plan, they wanted to transfer money from the dormant accounts to various new accounts," said the NCB Zonal Director.

"The accused revealed that for money laundering, Robert Polanco, American national came to India in the month of January. Robert and Kumar stayed in a Hotel at Gurugram. They contacted an official of a prominent bank who promised to arrange the necessary clearance. As per the investigation, they paid Rs 10 lakh in advance to the bank official. The total amount to be laundered was to the tune of Rs 16 crore. In this whole planning, Vishal, who is lodged in Tihar jail was actively connecting with all the members," said the Malhotra.

"Further investigation is underway and the information regarding money laundering is being shared with the Enforcement Directorate for necessary action," Malhotra further said.

Title: Coronavirus slows down Capital’s lifeline metro
Article:
Delhi Metro Rail Corporation, lifeline of the national Capital, is also not free from the impact of coronavirus, official disclosed on Wednesday.

The outbreak of the disease has already claimed thousands of lives around the globe, thus adversly impacting trade.

China, which is popular for supplying the hardware tools required for transport infrastructure, is now facing tough time due to COVID -19.

Capital's majority of population depend on Delhi metro to reach their destinations each day. However, the slow import of repairing tools and parts from China, may impact the service as according to DMRC official, the corona outbreak has led to a delay in the repair of an escalator at the Vishwavidyalaya metro station as spare parts could not be procured immediately.

According to officials, the escalator repair requires spare parts from China "The essential spare which is manufactured in China is being arranged. However, this may take some time because of the prevailing situation due to coronavirus," the DMRC said.

Title: inbrief
Article:
CHSGP-9 dehydrator rail renovated

The problem of dehydrator rail of Cast House Slag Granulation Plant (CHSGP) No 9 of BSL Blast Furnace No 5 has been resolved. On successful completion of the renovation work, Executive Director (Operations) Atanu Bhowmik congratulated the team members involved in this task. During this, Chief General Manager (Maintenance) DN Mohanty, Chief General Manager (Blast Furnace) Anjani Kumar and other senior officers were present. It is known that in the last few months, due to the problem of dehydrator rail, the normal working of CHSGP No. 9 was getting affected. The completion of this work will increase the quality, production and reliability of CHSGP No 9.

BSL to hold free medical camp

A one-day free mega medical camp will be organized by the Corporate Social Responsibility Department of Bokaro Steel Plant at Madarsa, Bharra on 12 March. In this camp Bokaro General Hospital general practitioner, ophthalmologist, gynecologist, pediatrician, dentist will be present. Height, weight, blood pressure in the camp, as well as pathology tests, will also check for hemoglobin, random blood sugar, urine albumin, urine sugar and pregnancy etc. Apart from this, free medicine and sanitary napkins will also be distributed in the camp. BGH will also be referred for further treatment to cataract, club-foot patients as needed. Patients will also be provided treatment facility by acupressure therapy.

Title: Chief Minister for taking village legacy forward
Article:
Chief Minister Hemant Soren today stressed on taking the rich legacy of villages forward. The CM was in his native village Nemra in Ramgarh district on Wednesday to greet the locals on the occasion of Holi and Baha Porob.

“The soul of Jharkhand stays in the villages. It is the priority of the Government to make development reach every village in the State. As the Chief Minister of the State, it is my responsibility to remove the problems of the people. For this every hour of every day is dedicated to the public,” he said.

On this occasion people informed the CM about their problems and gave applications in this regard. The Chief Minister also gave necessary instructions to the officials on the spot to solve the problems of the people.

The CM said that he is aware of the power cuts by DVC in some districts for 18 hours due to dues. The government will review the matter very soon and will decide on what can be done. Improving the power system is the priority of the government.

The CM said that in his native village Nemra, he felt very good among his people. “My whole family has gathered here. What could be better than this? The words of love and affection that people gave here cannot be mentioned in words. I will not be able to forget these moments,” he said.

There was an atmosphere of excitement in the whole village about the arrival of Chief Minister at his ancestral village Nemra. Hundreds of people from the surrounding areas had come to see their Chief Minister. They welcomed the Chief Minister in the traditional way.

On this occasion, JMM Supremo Shibu Soren and other relatives, MLA Mamta Devi, DDC Sanjay Sinha and other officials of Ramgarh district administration were present.

Meanwhile, on the order of the CM process has been started to provide financial held to Giridih resident 12-year-old Soni Kumari. In this regard, DC Giridih informed that Soni Kumari, who is being treated at RIMS, Ranchi would be provided relief under the Chief Minister's Critical Illness Scheme by preparing an estimate for treatment in Higher Health Institute. The CM had directed the Deputy Commissioner Giridih to take action under the Critical Illness Scheme for the treatment of Soni, whose both kidneys are dysfunctional.

Another patient Arshi Naaz, who is suufering from cancer, has been provided relief under Critical Illness Scheme on the instructions of the CM. DC, Dhanbad has informed the CM that Rs 1.20 Lakh is being paid in favour of Naaz as per the documents provided by Tata Memorial Hospital.

Title: BJP names Deepak Prakash as RS candidate
Article:
The BJP on Wednesday named Deepak Prakash as its Rajya Sabha candidate from Jharkhand nearly a fortnight after he was appointed as State BJP president. For winning the Rajya Sabha election in State, BJP requires the support of 27 MLAs, while it has the 26 MLAs including Babulal Marandi, who is MLA from Dhanwar.

BJP named Deepak Prakash as Rajya Sabha candidate on the day when JMM chief Shibu Soren filed nomination for Rajya Sabha candidate as JMM candidate.

After Chief Minister Hemant Soren leaving the Dumka seat the strength of MLAs in 81-member State Assembly has come down to 80. For winning the election, JMM requires the support 27 MLAs and the party has support of 29 MLAs in such situation JMM Chief Shibu Soren is sure to enter Rajya Sabha. After the first preference 27 MLAs, 52 MLAs are left and then any party needs the support of 27 MLAs as first preference for winning the election. BJP has 25 MLAs and including Marandi the strength the party is 26. The party requires the support of only one MLA for sailing the Rajya Sabha election.

As only one vote is needed by BJP to win the election the party is confident of winning the election. BJP legislative party leader Babulal Marandi said, “We are sure to win the election. AJSU party is traditional alliance of NDA and in such situation we are expecting that AJSU party having two MLAs will support BJP candidate.” Marandi also claimed that BJP will also contact independent legislators including Jamshedpur east MLA Saryu Roy for supporting Prakash. Roy the former minister in Raghubar Das Cabinet had defeated Das in last Assembly election. The saffron party is also optimistic of getting support of Amit Yadav the independent MLA from Barkatha.

BJP naming Deepak Prakash as Rajya Sabha candidate also gain importance as he had once again outwitted many bigwigs who were in fray for Rajya Sabha candidates. Former Chief Minister Raghubar Das, former BJP State President Ravindra Rai and newly-elected State President Deepak Prakash were among the frontrunners for the candidature.Prakash enjoys a close relationship with J.P. Nadda right from the time the BJP national president’s father, N.L. Nadda, was vice-chancellor of Ranchi University from August 1978 to April 1980.

Continued on Page 4 Apart from closeness with Nadda, he also enjoys good rapport with Babulal Marandi. In 2000 when Marandi became first Chief Minister of State, Prakash was made the chairman of Jharkhand State Mineral Development Corporation Ltd.

Prakash was among the leaders of the BJP who had quit the party along Marandi in 2006. But he returned in the BJP very soon. Prakash is also close to both former chief minister Raghubar Das and Babulal Marandi, two strong poles of the BJP in Jharkhand, and is known as a soft-spoken man of organisation.

Title: MPs meet FM over Rs 545 cr temple fund in Yes Bank
Article:
Four BJD MPs on Wednesday met Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in New Delhi seeking release of the fund of Rs 545 crore deposited by the Shree Jagannath Temple Administration in the crisis-hit Yes Bank.

Prasanna Acharya, Achyuta Samanta, Dr Amar Patnaik and Dr Sasmit Patra held talks with Sitharaman pleaded for withdrawal of the money from the bank. They also handed over a copy of the letter in this regard written by State Finance Minister Niranjan Pujari to Sitharaman.

Prasanna Acharya told reporters that the Union Finance Minister assured the MPs about the safety of the fund deposited in the Yes Bank.

Pujari has written to Sitharaman requesting her to issue necessary instruction to the Reserve Bank of India to allow release of the deposit relating to SJTA in the Yes Bank in the interest of millions of devotees of Lord Jagannath.

Notably, the amount of Rs 545 crore has been deposited in the Yes Bank, Puri branch in form of TDRs.

Title: Jagannath fund deposit row stalls House
Article:
The State Assembly witnessed adjournments and couldn’t conduct businesses in morning hours on the first day of its second phase of the Budget Session on Wednesday as Congress members protested parking of Rs 545 crore belonging to the Jagannath Temple, Puri in the private Yes Bank.

Soon after Obituary references, Congress members raised the issue and wanted to know why a fund of Rs 545 crore of Lord Jagannath was parked as Fixed Deposit in the Yes Bank, which has weakened financially. As Speaker called for holding the Question Hour discussion, Tara Prasad Bahinipati, Suresh Routray and other Congress MLAs trooped into the Well of the House and kept shouting slogans like “Jagannathnka Paisa Khaila Kie”. Unable to run the proceedings of the House, Speaker Surjya Narayan Patro adjourned the House at 10.41 am till 12.30 pm and again till 3 pm.

However, the House functioned normally during afternoon houses.

Raising the issue again, Congress member Santosh Singh Saluja demanded that Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik make a statement regarding safety of the Lord Jagannath’s fund. He said people feel insecurity when the Lords’ money is unsafe. He alleged that a Government officer had gone on a tour to Switzerland by taking advantage of the deposit in the private bank. Leader of Opposition (BJP) Pradipta Naik termed that the deposit as a sensitive issue and demanded that criminal action against officials who deposited the money in the private bank (Yes Bank) in violation of Shree Jagannath Temple Act and Government norms.

Title: Establish fire stations on distance criteria
Article:
Inclusion of all police stations under the 5T initiative to provide citizen-centric service under the Mo Sarkar scheme is quite effective. There is a need of provision of adequate amount of funds under the “Other Contingency” unit for 587 PSs.

A Standing Committee report on scrutiny of demand for grants for the year 2020-21 relating to the Home Department observed this in its report presented in the State Assembly on Wednesday. It recommended that the Marine Police Stations be strengthened and well equipped to face any kind of threat in coastal areas.

The staff strength of each police station be increased at pat with the national norms of the police stations to meet the present law and order situation in the State.

Necessary steps need to be taken for opening one postmortem centre in each CHC of the State.

Mentioning that the housing satisfaction of the Police Organisation is much less than the national average, the committee recommended for provision of sufficient funds to meet the requirement and complete the ongoing projects. It recommended for enhancement of plinth area for residential area in respect of Type D, E, F houses of employees of police, fire and prisons for better living conditions.

The panel also suggested for additional provision of Rs 10 crore by the Works Department for repair and maintenance of residential quarters of Fire Service personnel.

The committee recommended that the Government consider distance as criteria for opening of new fire stations instead of “one in each block” norm to provide better rescue services to the citizen of remote areas.

Vacancies in Home Guard posts many be filled up and their salary may be increased from Rs 300 to Rs 500.

For providing fire support to VIP carcade, required SUV vehicles need to be provided and required funds be made available to the Fire Service organisation for the

service.

The other recommendations include adequate budgetary allocation for provision of ambulance to major jails, filling up the vacancy of doctors in different jails.

The committee also suggested for necessary amendments in the Recruitment Rules for completion of recruitment process with minimum three phases for different cadres in police organisation and physical test be conducted for those who are qualified in written examination require for timely completion of recruitment process. If necessary, recruitment examinations should be conducted online.

Necessary steps should be taken for opening of new Fire Service Range Offices at Bhubaneswar, Angul, Baleswar, Koraput and Rourkela.

The committee comprised MLAs Kishore Mohanty as Chairman and MLAs Jaya Narayan Mishra, Anant Das, Pranab Prakash Das, Rohit Pujari, Prasant Muduli, Braja Kishore Pradhan, K Narayan Rao, Mohammad Moquim, Ramesh Chandra Sai, Devi Ranjan Tripathy and Sanjib Mallick as members.

Title: Number of Odia IAS officers declining: Min
Article:
Higher Education Minister Dr Arun Kumar Sahoo on Wednesday informed the State Assembly that the State Government is implementing an IAS coaching programme in view of a gradual declining in the number of Odia IAS officers in Odisha.

“The number of Odia IAS officers is declining in the State. The Government has received proposals from different circles to provide IAS coaching to Odia students. Thus, the IAS coaching programme for Odia students has started,” the Minister said in response to a question of BJD MLA Anant Das.

The Minister informed that the training has been provisioned for 100 boys and girls. The State Government has inked an agreement with the “Dhyeya IAS” to provide training on March 7, 2019.

According to norms, eligible students would compulsorily attend 90 per cent classes. They would get training in two batches. While 50 will get training from 7.30 to 10 am, the rest 50 would get training rom 6 to 8 pm. This training is being provided free of cost to students whose parents’ income is below Rs 2 lakh per annum.

Title: Six senior IPS officers transferred
Article:
The Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal on Wednesday transferred six Indian Police Service (IPS) officers of Delhi Police.

According to order issued by the L-G office, Mohammad Akhtar, the Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP), land and building has been given the charge of additional DCP Northeast district.

The IPS 2008 batch, Chinmoy Biswal has been posted as DCP, headquarters. Manjeet, who has been transferred on inter-cadre from Bihar has been given the charge as the DCP, Metro unit.

Jitendra Singh who was the DCP, Anti-riots cells has been transferred as DCP, land and building while Vikram Porwal, the DCP, Metro has been given the charge as special officer to Delhi Police Commissioner. Nishant Gupta, who was looking after the work of Additional DCP, SWAT has been transferred to Additional DCP, recruitment cell.

Title: Unseasonal rain to hit crops: IMD
Article:
Farmers in northern and northwest India should be prepared for winter crops-wheat and mustard damage because of unseasonal rain and hailstorms as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Wednesday predicted wet weather will visit north and northwest India for the next three days starting Wednesday (March 11).

The IMD has traced out the latest western disturbance over Afghanistan, which has induced the formation of an offspring circulation over South-West Rajasthan. “On Thursday, however, the western disturbance activity is set to hit its peak, due to which all of the north and northwest India and union territories will be under the orange alert.

The root cause of these weather conditions is a western disturbance that lies over Afghanistan as a cyclonic circulation. The westerly winds generated by this disturbance will be interacting with the easterly winds from the Bay of Bengal that will penetrate the plains of northwest India, thereby causing rainfall over the region,” the IMD said.

On the other hand, agriculture ministry officials said that unseasonal rains and hailstorm accompanying with high velocity wind has damaged the standing crops of wheat and muster in Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Himachal Pradesh Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and Uttarakhand face the risk of hailstorms this week.

“The State Government has been asked to assess the damage due to winter rain,” said officials.

According to the IMD, isolated heavy rain and snowfall is expected over Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh, and Gilgit-Baltistan on Thursday, and over Himachal Pradesh on Thursday and Friday. Isolated heavy showers are also likely over Punjab on Thursday, and across Uttarakhand, Haryana, and Chandigarh on Friday.

Apart from these isolated heavy showers, the rest of the Western Himalayan region (WHR) and northwestern plains are likely to experience light to moderate fairly widespread to widespread rains between March 11 and 13, except Rajasthan, which shall receive isolated rainfall only. “Active western disturbances may take a break after this, and international models projected that the next big one may reach Turkey, Syria and Jordan by March 20. It would take four to five days for it to cross Iran, Iraq, Afghanistan and Pakistan before entering North-West India. In between, comparably weaker disturbances may chug their way into North-West India,” the IMD said.

Moreover, thunderstorms accompanied by lightning, hail, and gusty winds (speed reaching 30-40 kmph or more) at isolated places are also in the forecast for the WHR and the plains in the same three-day period.

A day later, on Friday, the orange alert will remain over Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Delhi, Haryana, Chandigarh, and Uttar Pradesh only, whereas dry weather will possibly return to the rest of the states and UTs.

Title: Elderly infected woman in Kerala serious: Officials
Article:
The health condition of an 85-year old woman being treated for COVID-19 at the isolation ward of the Government medical college hospital here is serious, health officials said on Wednesday.

In view of her chronic health condition like heart disease, she is serious while her 96-year old husband is stable, they said.

They are the parents of a coronavirus affected man who returned from Italy on February 29 alongwith his wife and 24- year old son.

Meanwhile, a doctor running a clinic in Thiruvathukkal has been put under observation after the district authorities came to know that two coronavirus infected persons had consulted him for fever in the initial stage.

Title: Kerala puts 45 Italy returnees under watch
Article:
Stepping up efforts to check the spread of coronavirus in Kerala, the State Government has put at least 45 people who returned here from COVID-19 hit Italy under observation, official sources said on Wednesday.

Officials had referred 35 people, including two children and two pregnant women, to a government district hospital in Aluva on their arrival from Italy on Tuesday.

Ten suffering from fever and breathing problems were admitted to the Kalamassery Medical College Hospital and they will continue to remain under observation, officials said. The 35 people were later allowed to go home.

“Those 35 people who are asymptomatic have been advised to remain home quarantined for 28 days and will be under constant monitoring of health officials in primary health centres in their respective areas.

Strict legal action will be initiated, if they violate the protocol,” a government release said.

Details of Italian returnees hailing from Ernakulam, Kottayam, Alappuzha, Pathanamthitta, Thrissur and Kasaragod districts will be given to police in their respective areas, officials said.

Title: Schools, colleges, university, cinema halls shut in J&K
Article:
After shutting down cinema halls, the Government of Jammu & Kashmir on Wednesday decided to suspend teaching and class work in all schools, colleges and universities (public & private) and closure of anganwari centres till 31st March, 2020 in the wake of emerging situation due to COVID-19. However, Board and other competitive examinations shall be conducted as per schedule.

Meanwhile, Srinagar Municipal Corporation has also ordered closure of public clubs, sports clubs, indoor and open stadiums, coaching centers within Srinagar city limits till further orders. The order within SMC limits takes effect from tomorrow.

Addressing a press conference in Jammu,Director National Health Mission (NHM), Bhupinder Kumar told reporters, “a total number of 1,211 travellers and persons in contact with suspected cases have been put under active surveillance; 150 of these have completed surveillance period of 28 days while as 12 are undergoing hospital quarantine”.

Kumar added that 64 samples of suspected cases have been sent for testing so far; 28 have reported negative, 01 has tested positive and report of 35 is still awaited.

Director Information & Public Relations Dr. Syed Sehrish Asgar and Nodal Officer, Corona virus, UT J&K, Dr. Shafqat Khan were present on the occasion. Spelling out measures being taken up to control and prevent spread of this Virus, Director informed that control rooms and surveillance teams have been constituted in all the districts of UT besides two Corona-Virus lab testing facilities have already been made functional in SKIMS, Srinagar and GMC, Jammu.

Urging people to contribute in tackling the situation, Director NHM appealed all incoming passengers returning to J&K having travel history to China, Hong Kong, Republic of Korea, Japan, Italy, Thailand, Singapore, Iran, Malaysia, France, Spain and Germany to undergo self-imposed quarantine for a period of 14 days from the date of their arrival.

Bhupinder Kumar also said that the Government has urged citizens especially those with travel history to affected countries such as China, Italy, Iran, South Korea etc to self declare immediately and to report to the nearest Government health facility if any symptoms are found.

Kumar maintained that Novel Corona virus has no definite treatment so prevention is best and every person has a capacity to contribute in this situation.

He urged the public to maintain social distance and avoid unnecessary travel and use of public transport.

He reiterated that citizens must take basic precautions such as personal hygiene, hand washing, coughing and sneezing etiquettes and must avoid touching of face, eyes, nose and also report any symptoms (fever, difficult breathing and cough) to the medical authorities immediately in order to contain the virus.

Title: Karnataka man suspected to be infected dies
Article:
A 76-year-old man suspected to be infected with coronavirus died in Karnataka's Kalaburagi, District Health and Family Welfare department said on Wednesday.

An official note of the department in the district headquarters town identified him as Mohammed Hussain Siddiqui, who died in a government hospital on Tuesday. “His swab samples have been sent for a lab in Bengaluru. The report is awaited,” Department officials said.

Siddiqui had recently returned from Saudi Arabia, where he had gone on a pilgrimage, they said.

Title: Tripura to shut two border haat along Indo-Bangladesh border
Article:
The Tripura Government has decided to temporarily shut two border 'haat' (markets) along the India-Bangladesh border as a precautionary measure to check the spread of novel coronavirus, officials said on Wednesday.

A State health department advisory asked Land Custom and BSF officials to direct their staff to follow hygiene protocol for containing the infection, particularly from Bangladeshis.

“For the time being, Bangladeshis suffering from any respiratory problem should be assessed properly before their entry into our State.

“Moreover, all border haat may be closed for the time being in consultation with Bangladeshi authorities,” a memo signed by the Secretary of the Health and Family Welfare Department, Debasish Basu said.

Tripura has two border haat along the India-Bangladesh border —at Kamalasagar in Sepahijala district and Srinagar in South Tripura district. Both the border haat function on Sunday.

The memo also asked the district authorities and chief medical officers to maintain strict surveillance on gatherings, bus terminuses and railway stations to check the spread of coronavirus.

Help desks will be set up at Dharmanagar Railway Station in North Tripura district bordering Assam, it said.

The Dharmanagar Railway Station is one of the main entry points to the state.

Passengers would be checked and awareness created, encouraging visitors to report about their health status to the authorities, the memo said.

Meanwhile, Director of Health and Family Welfare, Radha Debbarma said no positive case of coronavirus has been detected in Tripura so far.

“No positive case of coronavirus has been found in the state so far. We had identified 28 persons who returned from affected countries.

Title: Goa Govt personnel, hospital staff to get masks as precaution
Article:
Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane on Wednesday said Government employees and staff of state-run hospitals will be equipped with masks as a precautionary measure against the spread of coronavirus.

Talking to reporters here, Rane also said the use of hand sanitizers is important and should be encouraged in schools and colleges.

“Masks will be provided to Government employees and hospital staff. Every department is advised to make use of masks and sterillium,” he said. People who visit hospitals need to take extra precautions, he added. “In view of the exponential rise in coronavirus cases, circulars on safety measures will be issued to every department,” Rane said.

The Minister said he would be writing to the secretaries of all departments to notify the staff about safety measures.

Title: Dinesh Mohania appointed AAP U’khand in-charge
Article:
The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Dinesh Mohania has been appointed as the in-charge of the party's Uttarakhand state unit.

Mohania, a three-time MLA from Delhi's Sangam Vihar, said he would hold a meeting with party officials in Uttarakhand.

The party is working on strengthening its organisation across the country after it registered a spectacular victory in the Delhi Assembly elections last month.

Title: Nirbhaya case: Convict moves court seeking FIR against cops for alleged prison assault
Article:
Pawan Kumar Gupta, one of the four death row convicts in the Nirbhaya gang rape and murder case, on Wednesday moved a Delhi court seeking registration of an FIR against two police constables for allegedly physically assaulting him when he was lodged at Mandoli jail last year.

The court of Chief Metropolitan Magistrate, Karkardooma has fixed Pawan's complaint for hearing on Thursday at 2 PM, lawyer AP Singh, counsel for the condemned prisoner, said.

The complaint seeks a direction to the SHO of Harsh Vihar Police Station to register the FIR against constable Anil Kumar and another unidentified police constable.

The complaint said that since Pawan is to be hanged soon, it is necessary to allow him to appear as a witness for identifying both policemen.

Title: Ready to jump into well for Scindia: MP Minister
Article:
Madhya Pradesh Minister and rebel Congress MLA Imarti Devi on Wednesday reaffirmed her loyalty to Jyotiraditya Scindia, who has joined the BJP, and said she will always stand alongside him "even if I had to jump into a well".

The women and child development minister said she and 21 other rebel Congress MLAs are camping in Bengaluru out of their own volition and with the blessings of Scindia.

Imarti Devi welcomed the former Congress leader's decision to join the BJP.

The MP Minister said she will accompany Scindia wherever he goes.

If Maharaj (Scindia) asks me or I myself feel that I need to jump into a well then I will do so for Maharaj, Imarti Devi said. Hum 22 log Bangalore me hai aur sabhi apni marji se hai. Shrimant Jyotiraditya Scindia ke ashirwad se hai. Accha nirnay liya hai Maharaj ne ke vo hum ko kisi jagah nahi le ke ja rahe hai.

"Agar Maharaj hum logan ko kisi jagah par nahi le ke jate aur hum logan se vo kahte ya mai apne se khud kahti hun ki agar kuan me girna hai to me kuan me girungi, par maharaj je sath rahungi, jahan hamare Shrimant maharaj sb hai, Imarti Devi be wahi hai.

"Jitne hum 22 vidhayak hai sab hansi khushi se hai, Imarti Devi said in a recorded statement issued here by Scindias supporters.

(We all are in Bengaluru out of our own wish and with the blessings of Shrimant (Scindia). It is a good decision (to join BJP) and if he is taking us to any place or our Maharaj says or I myself feel the need to fall into a well then I will do so and will remain with Scindia.) Scindia (49), who joined the BJP in Delhi in presence of party president J P Nadda, is likely to arrive here on Thursday.

Title: Lekhi lauds Shah in LS for containing Delhi riots in 36 hrs
Article:
The BJP on Wednesday alleged that the communal violence in Delhi was a pre-planned conspiracy and lauded Union Home Minister Amit Shah for containing the Delhi violence within 36 hours. The Opposition hit out at the Government as the riots had international ramifications and called for an impartial probe.

Participating in the debate in Lok Sabha on Delhi riots that have claimed 52 lives, BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi defended the Home Minister Amit Shah and said the violence was brought under control within 36 hours which, if you look at in hindsight, was in the making for months.

She also claimed that the Home Minister did not go to the violence-hit areas of northeast Delhi to avoid “splitting of security forces to guard him”. “What do you expect? That Home Minister would go and sit in a police station? Would that have not caused splitting of security forces just to guard him?” Lekhi asked.

The Lok Sabha discussed the Delhi riots under Rule 193 of the House proceedings which means there will be no voting after the debate.

Earlier, initiating the debate in the Lok Sabha, Congress leader sought resignation of Shah, a demand echoed by TMC’s Saugata Roy and NK Premachandran of RSP.

Responding to Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Choudhury allegations, Lekhi defended party leaders Anurag Thakur, Parvesh Verma and Kapil Mishra, who have been accused by the Opposition of setting the stage for the violence that rocked northeast Delhi and left more than 50 people dead. Anurag and Verma made comments on January 20 and January 28, while the violence started on February 23. Kapil Mishra was held responsible for acts of Amanatullah Khan, Sharjeel Imam and Tahir Hussain, she said.

Without naming the Congress, she blamed the grand old party for the riots and said the Government had controlled the violence in 36 hours. “During 1950 to 1964, as many as 243 riots are documented. When Indira Gandhi was Prime Minister, 337 riots happened during 1966 to 1977 and 1980 and 1984. Similarly, when Rajiv Gandhi was Prime Minister, 291 riots occurred during 1984 and 1989. Out of 1094 riots, 871 happened during Congress regime, which was 73 per cent,” she said.

Lekhi countered Chowdhury’s remarks on the role of Mussolini in the RSS ideology. She said that Chowdhury’s leader’s - who is sitting behind him (pointing at Rahul Gandhi without mentioning his name) - maternal grandfather was Mussolini’s soldier. Somehow Congress did not pick this mention as an issue, though Treasury Benches were supporting Lekhi with thumping in the desks.

Lekhi, alleged that some people are taking political benefit out of the incidents of violence. Referring to the killing of IB officer Ankit Sharma during the riots, she said 400 wounds were found on his body. “What kind of hatred was this... We should discuss that also,” she said, adding the riots were pre-planned. The BJP leader alleged that the opposition are defending minority vote bank politics and have forgotten about Sharjeel Imam and AAP MLA Amanatullah. Lok Sabha speaker Om Birla expunged certain names taken by Lekhi and asked her not to name people.

She alleged that after the speech of Congress leader Sonia Gandhi at Ramleela maidan, people started gathering. Similar speeches were given by Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi as well, Lekhi said. “Why the opposition is spreading rumours,” she said.

Tejasvi Surya of BJP alleged that while there wasn’t anything anti-Muslim in CAA, the anti-CAA protests had “a lot of anti-Hindu” feelings. BJP MPs Nalin Kateel also countered the Opposition accusations. BJP leader Nishikant Dubey said the transfer was recommended by the Supreme Court collegium and the Government had nothing to do with it.

AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi said there is a “tsunami of Hindutva hate” and called for an impartial probe to find the prepatrators of the violence. Some of his remarks evoked sharp response from the Treasury benches, with at least two Union Ministers — Ravi Shankar Prasad and Kishan Reddy — registering their protests. Reddy accused Owaisi and his party for erasing Hindus population from certain areas of Hyderabad.

This led to heated argument between the ruling and the opposition benches. Reminding members to keep cool and avoid mention of any communities, Speaker Om Birla ordered to expunge certain remarks made by Owaisi.

T R Baalu (DMK) said that the Delhi riots and the law and order situation of the national capital were discussed in parliaments of the UK, Iran, Indonesia, Turkey and Malaysia. These countries “are making fun of us”, he said.

Baalu said that “what went wrong” as over 50 people were killed in the Delhi violence. He said that although Delhi Police is efficient in manging the issues, “why all went wrong” on those days.

Title: ITBP chief SS Deswal given additional charge of BSF DG
Article:
ITBP Director General SS Deswal on Wednesday took additional charge of the BSF after its incumbent VK Johri was repatriated to parent cadre to take over as the Director General of Police of Madhya Pradesh.

An official order issued on Tuesday said Deswal will handle this charge “till the appointment and joining of the successor or until further orders, whichever is earlier”.

The Kamal Nath-led Congress Government in Madhya Pradesh had recently issued an order appointing Johri, a 1984-batch IPS officer, the new Director General of Police.

In the same order, the MP Government has shifted incumbent DGP VK Singh to the Sports and Youth Welfare Department as its Director.

DG of Cyber Cell of MP Police, Rajendra Kumar, a 1985-batch officer, has been asked to officiate as the DGP till Johri takes over.

Johri is expected to reach State capital Bhopal on Thursday and subsequently take over his new assignment soon. The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC), headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, had issued an order on Wednesday approving the proposal of the home ministry for repatriation of Johri to his parent cadre with an immediate effect.

Deswal, a 1984-batch Haryana cadre IPS officer, has earlier headed the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB)as its DG apart from handling the additional charge as the chief of Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) and National Security Guard (NSG).

Title: RS adjourned over Delhi riots, Kerala media gag
Article:
The Rajya Sabha on Wednesday witnessed repeated adjournments over a clutch of issues, including Delhi riots, ban on some media channels in Kerala and the treasury and the Opposition differing on taking up two ordinances which are lapsing on Thursday. All the parties finally agreed to discuss the ordinances pertaining to mines and minerals and insolvency code on Thursday morning followed by a discussion on the Delhi riots.
